case_vignette: A 63-year-old woman comes to the emergency department because of a 1-day history of progressive blurring and darkening of her vision in the right eye. Upon waking up in the morning, she suddenly started seeing multiple dark streaks. She has migraines and type 2 diabetes mellitus diagnosed at her last health maintenance examination 20 years ago. She has smoked one pack of cigarettes daily for 40 years. Her only medication is sumatriptan. Her vitals are within normal limits. Ophthalmologic examination shows visual acuity of 20/40 in the left eye and 20/100 in the right eye. The fundus is obscured and difficult to visualize on fundoscopic examination of the right eye. The red reflex is diminished on the right.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have been experiencing blurring and darkening of my vision in my right eye since yesterday.
Do you have any other symptoms apart from the blurring and darkening of vision?
Yes, I suddenly started seeing multiple dark streaks when I woke up in the morning.
Have you had any recent trauma to your head or eye?
No, I haven't had any recent trauma to my head or eye.
Do you have any medical history of diabetes, high blood pressure, or any eye conditions?
Yes, I was diagnosed with type 2 diabetes 20 years ago.
Are you currently taking any medications for your diabetes or any other medical condition?
I am only taking sumatriptan, which is for my migraines.
Do you have a family history of any eye conditions or vision problems?
I'm sorry, but the case vignette you've provided doesn't mention any details about my family history.

I understand, thank you for the information. Based on your symptoms, medical history of type 2 diabetes, and sudden onset of visual disturbances, I recommend an urgent visit to an ophthalmologist for further evaluation. This could be indicative of diabetic retinopathy, and prompt treatment is crucial to prevent further vision loss.
